content: stitches on your needles rounds 1-15 all stitches worked in mc *knit 1 purl 2 knit 1* repeat until the bor leg note you may find the left- and right-leaning decreases video helpful for this section you have finished working the ribbed cuff and will now work the leg set-up row all stitches worked in mc knit 1 k2tog knit until the bor you should have 51 59 67 75 83 91 stitches on your needles join your cc and work the adjacent chart when you have completed the chart cut both your mc and cc yarn note the faux seam is created by always knitting the first and last stitch of the round in the mc there are some row where all of the other stitches are worked in the cc and you will need to carry your mc from the first stitch to the final stitch i recommend catching your floats after six stitches when there are two of these row together make sure you catch your floats at different points to avoid your mc being visible on the rs for the row worked entirely in the mc you do not need to carry your cc 5 @thestitchling placing your forethought heel note you may find the placing your forethought heel video helpful for this section you will now place your forethought heel using a piece of scrap yarn knit the first 13 15 17 19 21 23 stitches of the round slip these stitches back onto your left needle rejoin your mc and knit 38 44 50 56 62 68 stitches with a second piece of scrap yarn knit the final 13 15 17 19 21 23 stitches of the round slip these stitches back onto your left needle using your mc knit until the bor foot rejoin your cc and work the adjacent chart until the foot of your sock is 8 25 8 75 9 5 10 75 11 5 12 25 cm / 3 1/ 3 1/ 3 3/ 4 1/ 4 1/ 4 3/ 4 2 4 4 2 4 shorter than your desired length this allows for the additional length which will be added by knitting the toe and heel to check the length of your sock s foot measure between the scrap yarn marking the forethought heel placement and your needles your desired foot length should be the measurement from the back of your heel to the tip of your big toe less 1 75 cm / 3/ finish the 4 foot chart with two mc row now knit the below chart cut your cc yarn the remainder of the sock toe and heel will be worked entirely in your mc yarn note if you find it difficult to judge whether the foot of your sock is the correct length without being able to try it on you can knit the first few motifs of the foot chart and then place the foot stitches on hold next progress to the picking
